exam.question: Diamonds have little ______ value and their price depends almost entirely on their scarcity. /(2003. 6)

answer.explain: 句意： 钻石本身并无什么内在价值， 其价格几乎完全是因为其数量稀少所致。extinct： 熄灭的， 灭绝的； permanent： 永久的， 持久的； surplus： 过剩的。

sentences.sContent: the intrinsic interest of the subject
...The author thinks the greatness of an art work still lies in its intrinsic value...
...The intrinsic quality of a work of art is starting to seem like its least important attribute...
...Some social scientists have raised doubts about the intrinsic value of certain works of art...

phrases.pCn: 特性粘度；固有粘度；本征粘度
内在因素；[医]（造血）内因子
内部函数；内在函数；固有功能

remMethod.val: intr(看作intro， 向内) ＋ insic(看作， inside) → 内在的， 本质的

trans.tranCn: 固有的； 本质的； 内在的
trans.tranOther: being part of the nature or character of someone or something
